newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bond market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bond market closing report.

text.p: Swiss bonds ended mostly lower, retracing some ground following cuts in money market interest rates in several European centres on Thursday.
The Swiss National Bank (SNB) confirmed that it was still "generous" with respect to money markets. But short term money market rates remained mostly above 2.00 percent on Friday.

Georg Rich, chief economist at the SNB, said in an interview published in the Saturday edition of Swiss weekly Finanz and Wirtschaft, released a day early to the press, that he saw no danger of inflationary repurcussions from the SNB's recent moves to add liquidity to the domestic money market.
Rich said that the Swiss economy was currently not so robust as to cause inflation from the SNB's actions.
Sept conf bond off six at 112.83.
Sept comi medium-term bond up 11 at 109.36.
Sept Euro Swiss francs off two at 97.77.
